A transaction is considered simple if it is a deployment or the target account is not a contract.","params":{"header":"Block header from the challenged block","previousRootProof":"Proof of the previous state root - if the transaction is a deployment, this can be null","receiverProof":"Proof of the receiver account in the previous state - if the transaction is a deployment, this can be null","siblings":"Merkle proof of the transaction's inclusion in the block","transactionBytes":"Encoded transaction - either IncomingTransaction struct or RLP encoded signed transaction","transactionIndex":"Index of the transaction in the block"}},"proveInsufficientBalanceError((bytes32,uint256,uint256,(uint256,bytes32,address,bytes32)),(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256),bytes,uint256,bytes32[],bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Prove that the caller of a transaction had an insufficient balance to cover the upfront cost. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction."},"proveInsufficientGasError((bytes32,uint256,uint256,(uint256,bytes32,address,bytes32)),(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256),bytes,uint256,bytes32[])":{"details":"Prove that a transaction had less gas than the base fee. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction."},"proveInvalidCreateTransaction((bytes32,uint256,uint256,(uint256,bytes32,address,bytes32)),(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256),bytes,uint256,bytes32[])":{"details":"Prove that a signed transaction targeted the null address, which is not allowed in the ISO blockchain. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction."},"proveInvalidNonceError((bytes32,uint256,uint256,(uint256,bytes32,address,bytes32)),(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,address,uint256),bytes,uint256,bytes32[],bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Prove that a transaction had a nonce which did not match the caller account. documentation.text:
@dev Proves that a signed transaction was executed incorrectly,
 where the receiver was not a contract.
 Note: Rather than updating the caller twice (for the gas refund),
 this simply charges 21000 gas. This gives the same end result.

cancelSimpleTransactionChallenge((bytes3.details: Cancels a challenge on a simple transaction, i.e. a transaction which can be audited without a message witness. A transaction is considered simple if it is a deployment or the target account is not a contract.

params.header: Block header from the challenged block
params.previousRootProof: Proof of the previous state root - if the transaction is a deployment, this can be null
params.receiverProof: Proof of the receiver account in the previous state - if the transaction is a deployment, this can be null
params.siblings: Merkle proof of the transaction's inclusion in the block
params.transactionBytes: Encoded transaction - either IncomingTransaction struct or RLP encoded signed transaction
params.transactionIndex: Index of the transaction in the block

proveInsufficientBalanceError((bytes32,u.details: Prove that the caller of a transaction had an insufficient balance to cover the upfront cost. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction.

proveInsufficientGasError((bytes32,uint2.details: Prove that a transaction had less gas than the base fee. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction.

proveInvalidCreateTransaction((bytes32,u.details: Prove that a signed transaction targeted the null address, which is not allowed in the ISO blockchain. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction.

proveInvalidNonceError((bytes32,uint256,.details: Prove that a transaction had a nonce which did not match the caller account. Note: Only valid for a signed transaction.

proveSimpleIncomingTransactionExecutionE.details: Prove that an incoming transaction was executed incorrectly, where the transaction was either a deployment or a simple value transfer.

proveSimpleSignedTransactionExecutionErr.details: Proves that a signed transaction was executed incorrectly, where the receiver was not a contract. Note: Rather than updating the caller twice (for the gas refund), this simply charges 21000 gas. This gives the same end result.
